channel.title: PyRS - Jython powered RSPS, written in Python, with efficient Java networking
channel.description:
Welp, here's one of my "let's see if I can do [i]this[/i]", projects. I thought it'd be a cool idea to develop an RSPS in Python, but I wanted it to have efficient networking, so I used Jython and Java NIO.
Almost everything is in Python, except for my StreamBuffer utility which is capable of doing anything with the RuneScape protocol. I'm releasing it to the public, you can do whatever you want with it. Or you can do nothing with it, your choice.
All it has is [b]login[/b], as I got bored after I achieved that. Maybe I'll make player updating, but don't count on it. Check it out if you're interested in exploring other territories with RuneScape emulation.
[b]Download:[/b] http://uppit.com/olntciegav9a/PyRS.zip

[/quote]It’s simple as fuck
[/quote]cough apparently not for some people /cough[/quote]thanks david.

item.title: PyRS - Jython powered RSPS, written in Python, with efficient Java networking
item.dc:creator: @Python1 Python_
item.description:
@Python1 wrote:

God, if your going to ask questions like:

-what client do I use?
-how do I run/compile?
-how I tz-Tok-jad and pkayzz?
-what is python?
-pic pls?
(bad grammar was on purpose…^)

Don’t even bother downloading if any of the above, or alternatives of those, are running through your head.

@on-topic:
Nice, definatley going to check this out. To reiterate what was stated above, what are some advantages and disadvantages of a server coded via python?

Read full topic

item.title: PyRS - Jython powered RSPS, written in Python, with efficient Java networking
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Welp, here’s one of my “let’s see if I can do this”, projects.
I thought it’d be a cool idea to develop an RSPS in Python, but I wanted it to have efficient networking, so I used Jython and Java NIO.

Almost everything is in Python, except for my StreamBuffer utility which is capable of doing anything with the RuneScape protocol.
I’m releasing it to the public, you can do whatever you want with it. Or you can do nothing with it, your choice.

All it has is login, as I got bored after I achieved that. Maybe I’ll make player updating, but don’t count on it.
Check it out if you’re interested in exploring other territories with RuneScape emulation.

Download: http://uppit.com/olntciegav9a/PyRS.zip
